title: Slow Cooker Pot Roast Recipe
description: This slow cooker pot roast is easy to make with a chuck roast, potatoes, carrots, celery, and onion soup mix for tender and juicy results every time.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Beef Pot Roast Recipes Slow Cooker Pot Roast 4.6 (2,536) 1,814 Reviews 142 Photos This slow cooker pot roast always turns out moist and juicy. It's cooked with carrots, onion, celery, and potatoes. Submitted by Marie Bongiovanni Thomas Updated on October 10, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 142 142 142 142 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 8 hrs 20 mins Total Time: 8 hrs 40 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 4 pounds chuck roast salt and pepper to taste 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 packet dry onion soup mix 1 cup water 3 carrots, chopped 3 potatoes, peeled and cubed 1 onion, chopped 1 stalk celery, chopped Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season chuck roast with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat; add roast and sear to brown, about 4 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place roast in the slow cooker and sprinkle soup mix on top. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add water, and scatter carrots, potatoes, onion, and celery on top. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover and cook on Low for 8 to 10 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 4,094 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 540 Calories 31g Fat 18g Carbs 46g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 540 % Daily Value * Total Fat 31g 39% Saturated Fat 12g 61% Cholesterol 147mg 49% Sodium 272mg 12% Total Carbohydrate 18g 7% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Total Sugars 2g Protein 46g 91% Vitamin C 18mg 20% Calcium 47mg 4% Iron 6mg 33% Potassium 1173mg 25% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker Pot Roast 01 of 142 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 142 Photo by  Adela Lynn Reinke 12/11/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Great flavors Crowd-pleaser Family favorite It was the first meal In my new crockpot and it was so easy and delicious. Very hearty meal. 03 of 142 Photo by  BraveKiwi3424 04/30/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Everyone loved the pot roast. I made a few adjustments to the recipe. I used a chuck roast because it is marbled, and I did not trim any fat. Many cooks know that fat equals flavor. I also used boiler unions instead of chopped onions, and I used beef broth instead of water. I also used Lipton's BEEFY ONION dry soup mix (sprinkled on top of the roast), and I used whole baby red potatoes. The roast was done after 8 hours on the low setting. 04 of 142 Photo by  carrie h 03/31/2024 A keeper! Did recipe exactly.This was perfect at 8 hours on low.Tender and tasty. 05 of 142 Photo by  Shanas Kitchen Table 01/16/2024 This pot roast is really good. I think most home cooks will find it manageable. I served it with Cran-Rasberry Sauce. Thank you for sharing. I didn't add soup mix, as I simply sprinkled in onion and garlic powder, salt, beef bouillon, and dried onion. 06 of 142 Photo by  Janice Barry 07/02/2023 My go to from now on. Perfectly tender. I did add veggies two hours before end time and they came out perfect. Hubby loved it too! 07 of 142 Photo by  Michael Fox 01/22/2023 Super easy. Made it for my wife and myself. We didn't have the dry onion soup mix and substituted a can of Campbell's onion soup instead. 08 of 142 Photo by  humblepieliving 05/25/2022 This crock pot roast was fine, but did end up a little dry. It’s a good starting off recipe, but felt it could use more flavors. It was a good basic meal that my kids ate with rolls! But word of advice, expect to cook for a least 10 hours. 09 of 142 Photo by  Juana Mason 04/20/2022 I enjoyed making this! and it was really tasty. I had to improvise the ingredients because I did not realise I had no onions nor celery. But I did use the dry onion mix and I had celery seasoning and seeds. I also added about a tablespoon of A1 sauce. I even added a packet of the brown gravy mix. I also added a little parsley along with the thyme. Came out so tender and juicy. I put everything into the crock pot around 11pm and by 6:30am, my whole house was smelling heavenly! Now this picture is of packing some for lunch straight out the pot. 10 of 142 Photo by  Rhonda M.
